monogr.author: Sørensen, Søren
monogr.title: Index to the Names in the Mahabharata
with short explanations and a concordance to the Bombay and Calcutta editions and P. C. Roy's translation

biblStruct.note: Issued in parts. When Dr. Sørensen died, pages 1-32 had been put into type and the manuscript of the preface, the concordance and pages 33-153 had been put into final shape. The revision and final preparation of the manuscript was committed to Elof Olesen under the superintendence of Dines Andersen. Cf. Postscriptum.

monogr.author: Sørensen, Søren
monogr.title: Index to the Names in the Mahabharata
with short explanations and a concordance to the Bombay and Calcutta editions and P. C. Roy's translation

projectDesc.p: The Cologne Digital Sanskrit Lexicon (CDSL) project undertakes to digitize and merge all published Sanskrit dictionaries. Its aim is to create a basic lexical corpus that provides easy access to all available meanings of Sanskrit words and allows the creation of a number of computer programs that will help to analyze Sanskrit texts.

This material is based upon work supported by the National Endowment for the Humanities under Grant No. HG-50022-10. Any views, findings, conclusions, or recommendations expressed in this material do not necessarily represent those of the National Endowment for the Humanities.

creation.p: Data-entry in Kyoto-Harvard encoding by typists in Azhivaikkal in Thanjavur district, Tamilnadu under the direction of Thomas Malten, with character codes partially marking divisions in the text. Funderburk transformed it to xml. Corrections were evaluated by Malten, Scharf, and implemented by Funderburk.

langUsage.language: Sanskrit in Sanskrit Library Phonetic Basic encoding, a phonetic Romanization using only ASCII characters

revisionDesc.change: Revisions documented by Jim Funderburk. See
